1FSV Model¶

In this subpackage (ajdmom.mdl_1fsv), we consider the SV model in Theory, i.e.,

\[\begin{split}ds(t) &= \mu s(t)dt + \sqrt{v(t)}s(t)dw^s(t),\\ dv(t) &= k(\theta - v(t))dt + \sigma_v\sqrt{v(t)}dw^v(t),\end{split}\]

which is also the baseline SV model of the package.

The derivation of its moments has been explained in Program Design page.

API¶

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.cmom

Central Moments for One-Factor SV

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.mom

Moments for One-Factor SV

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.cov

Covariance for One-Factor SV

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.euler

Module for generating samples from Heston SV model by Euler approximation

Moments for One-Factor SV

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.mom.b_n(n1, n2, n3, n4, n5)¶

Represent \(b_2(\boldsymbol{n})\) in (7) in Poly

Parameters:

  • n1 – times of constant being selected.

  • n2 – times of \(v_{n-1}\) being selected.

  • n3 – times of \(eI_n\) being selected.

  • n4 – times of \(I_n\) being selected.

  • n5 – times of \(I_n^{*}\) being selected.

Returns:

a poly with attibute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’,’sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

Return type:

Poly

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.mom.dm(l, par, wrt)¶

Partial derivative of moment w.r.t. parameter wrt

Parameters:

  • l – order of the moment.

  • par – parameters in dict.

  • wrt – with respect to.

Returns:

scalar of the partial derivative.

Return type:

float

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.mom.dpoly(poly, wrt)¶

Partial derivative of central moment w.r.t. parameter wrt

Parameters:

  • poly – central moment represented by the poly whoes attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’,’sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

  • wrt – with respect to.

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’k^{-}’,’mu’,’theta’,’sigma_v’,’rho’,’sqrt(1-rho^2)’).

Return type:

Poly

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.cmom.ve_IEII(n2, n3, n4, n5)¶

\(v_{n-1}^{n_2} e^{-n_3knh} IEII\)

Parameters:

  • n2 – \(n_2\) in above formula.

  • n3 – \(n_3\) in \(IEII\) which is \(E[eI_n^{n_3}I_n^{n_4}I_n^{*n_5}|v_{n-1}]\).

  • n4 – \(n_4\) in \(IEII\).

  • n5 – \(n_5\) in \(IEII\).

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-kh}’,’h’,’v_{n-1}’,’k^{-}’,’theta’,’sigma_v’).

Return type:

Poly

  • m4 – times of \(I_{n}\) being selected.

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.cov.ve_IEII_vn(n2, n3, n4, n5)¶

Compute \(v_n^{n_2}e^{-n_3k(n+1)h} IEII\) and expand \(v_n\)

Parameters:

  • n2 – \(n_2\) in above equation.

  • n3 – \(n_3\) in \(IEII\) which is \(E[eI_{n+1}^{n_3}I_{n+1}^{n_4}I_{n+1}^{*n_5}|v_n]\).

  • n4 – \(n_4\) in \(IEII\).

  • n5 – \(n_5\) in \(IEII\).

Returns:

poly with attribute keyfor = (‘e^{-knh}eI_n’,’e^{-kh}’,’h’,’v_{n-1}’,’k^{-}’,’theta’,’sigma_v’).

Return type:

Poly

Module for generating samples from Heston SV model by Euler approximation

To facilitate the verification of the correctness of our codes by comparison the population moments (given by our package) and their sample counterparts. Here I define function r1FSV().

ajdmom.mdl_1fsv.euler.r1FSV(v_0, par, N, n_segment=10, h=1)¶

Generate samples from mdl_1fsv by Euler approximation

Parameters:

  • v_0 – value of the initial variance \(v(0)\).

  • par – parameters in a dict.

  • N – target length of samples to generate.

  • n_segment – number of segments each interval is splitted into.

  • h – time interval between each two consecutive samples.

Returns:

a sequence of samples.

Return type:

numpy 1-D array.

ajdmom
